intro: Sphacophyllum stuhlmannii, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, blue-green leaves. Its flowers are small, star-shaped, and typically appear in clusters during the spring and summer months. Sphacophyllum stuhlmannii is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
